windows.symptom: Downloading Itunes trouble        Hello,      Sadly I am pretty illiterate when it comes to computers, software, updates, etc.  I purchased a 2nd hand Lenovo ThinkPad W530.  Hoping it will last me a long time.  I do not game or use it other than for school.  I am trying to download iTunes to reset my sons iPhone that is locked up.  I go to the Microsoft store, and select to download it.  My computer says, "starting download..."  and in the download queue.  nothing is happening.  I have tried this several times, restarted my computer, cannot get the download to engage. Please help.Emicabra
solutions: Hi Emi. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.Install the iTunes program which is more stable that the store app. Here's how: https://www.imore.com/how-install-itunes-12-win...If problems follow these steps: https://support.apple.com/lv-lv/HT201668http://www.groovypost.com/howto/tips-install-it...https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT201413https://discussions.apple.com/docs/DOC-6562I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and keep me posted. If you will wait to choose if I solved your problem, I will keep working with you until it's resolved.________________________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.

Once that's done then here's the steps for restoring an iDevice using Itunes on PC:https://support.apple.com/guide/itunes/restore-...Keep me posted on your progress as I will be here to help until the case is resolved.

Hi Emicaibr,As it is a 2nd hand computer, it is more likely you can remove components left from a previous installation of iTunes and then reinstall to fix the problems.  If not work,  you should uninstall QuickTime, AppleSoftware Update, Apple Mobile Device Support, Bonjour, and Apple Application Support from the control panel.After that, you close and reopen your computer. Go to My Document ----> My Music, there you delete the folder of iTunes.Regards

I also received this advice.  Please tell me what you think.  This person did not say whether or not they were experienced or certified or anything. As it is a 2nd hand computer, it is more likely you can remove components left from a previous installation of iTunes and then reinstall to fix the problems.  If not work,  you should uninstall QuickTime, AppleSoftware Update, Apple Mobile Device Support, Bonjour, and Apple Application Support from the control panel.After that, you close and reopen your computer. Go to My Document ----> My Music, there you delete the folder of iTunes.

windows.symptom: How do I see if my current PC will support Windows 10        I currently have Windows 7.   How can I see if my current PC will support Windows 10?  Is there a diagnostics I can run?
solutions: Hi, Do you have the "Get Windows 10" option available in the system tray? The hamburger menu in that app had a "Check your PC" option. The same checks should run when upgrading with the Media Creation Tool from the Windows 10 download page.There isn't a big jump between Windows 7 and Windows 10's minimum specs. Windows 10 is currently:CPU: 1 gigahertz (GHz) or faster processor or SoC RAM: 1 gigabyte (GB) for 32-bit or 2 GB for 64-bit Hard disk space: 16 GB for 32-bit OS or 20 GB for 64-bit OS GPU: DirectX 9 or later Display Resolution: 800 x 600

windows.symptom: Virus Scan Failed ERROR!        Hi And I have this issue where it says "virus scan failed" every time I DOWNLOAD something I even tried using edge and even ie and it still doesn't work.And the regedit trick doesn't work And I uninstalled my antivirus Please help!Browser I am using: Google ChormeOS: Windows 10 (64 bit)
solutions: Hi Retroguy. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.1) First see the posts by Neilpzzz and MVP LeBoule here: https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/for...2) Download, install and run a full scan with the most powerful on-demand free scanner Malwarebytes:https://www.malwarebytes.com/mwb-download/.In the Scan Settings first set it to include scanning for Rootkits. If necessary run it in Safe Mode with Networking, or Safe Mode accessed by one of these methods:https://www.digitalcitizen.life/4-ways-boot-saf... Clean up anything found, restart PC and then run again until it comes up clean. Check for any remainders in Settings > Apps > Apps & Features, and also in each of your browser's Extensions, Home Page settings, Search service or Add-On's as shown here:https://community.box.com/t5/How-to-Guides-for-... Then check for damaged System Files: https://www.lifewire.com/how-to-use-sfc-scannow... If it cannot repair them see Step 10 here to continue: http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki... If that doesn't fix it then try resetting Chrome: https://www.lifewire.com/how-to-reset-google-ch...If that fails uninstall Chrome, restart PC, and reinstall from a fresh download: https://www.google.com/chrome/If you want to keep Malwarebytes as an on-demand scanner then you can turn off its Real Time trial version in it's Settings > Account Details tab.I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and let us know how it goes. I will keep working with you until it's resolved.______________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.

windows.symptom: best antivirus for internet banking        hi can anyone tell me the best antivirus and security for banking and shopping online its not for me but daughter just got a new laptop with bascic  security on but she tried to download fsecure her normal security but tells her to switch out of s mode on windows 10 s baffling us.
solutions: Hi dwindle Windows 10 now contains a full security Suite, which includes Defender and many other components, it is on a par with all the paid for Security solutions and rated highly, there is no need for any other security softwareWith regards to installing F-Secure, it sounds like Windows 10 is in S Mode, that means only Apps form the Microsoft Store can be installed on that laptopThis is very limiting and you can switch Windows 10 out of S Mode to the normal Windows 10 Home version, it is free to do so and it is a one-way operation. Then you can install any software you need to on that laptop . . .Open the Settings App Go to Update and Security - Activation In the Switch to Windows 10 Home or Switch to Windows 10 Pro section, select Go to the Store. (If you also see an "Upgrade your edition of Windows" section, be careful not to click the "Go to the Store" link that appears there.)On the Switch out of S mode (or similar) page that appears in the Microsoft Store, select the Get button.After you see a confirmation message on the page, you'll be able to install apps from outside of the Microsoft Store.

FWIW:Microsoft created Windows 10 S mode for a reason: Security....> Windows 10 in S mode FAQ - Windows Help If you want to switch out of it: Since some weeks many users are not able to switch out of S mode. Seems that there are some problems on the Microsoft's servers side..Users are advised to try again in a few days or even weeks....

PS: In case that you do decide to switch out of S mode...Suggest reading Answers to common security questions - Best Practicesespecially Choosing an Anti-Virus ProgramSupplementing your Anti-Virus Program with Anti-Malware Tools

Microsoft OS comes with Windows Defender installed, and it's free and all its features. It provides full protection for free. Other antivirus softwares requires buying them or upgrading to premium to use full features. Microsoft Windows Defender provides all the features, for free.
Thank you very helpful
hank you very helpful
You're welcome.

windows.symptom: Windows 10 email access on IPhone        Recently I began using Windows 10 on my new home PC.  Currently I import emails from my Comcast account into Gmail.  I then can access emails on my home PC browser (Chrome) or through the Gmail app on my iPhone 7.  Emails are also visible through the W10 Mail app.  If I wanted to discontinue Gmail, how would I import emails from Comcast into W10 mail?  How would I also see them on my iPhone?Currently I prefer not to access Comcast email through xfinity.com or use their iPhone app.thank you
solutions: Hi Big Thanks for participating in Microsoft Community, I'm Skypper G. I'm Independent advisor, let me help you with thisSo, in this case you want to import emails from comcast account to Outlook account like Hotmail/outlook.com?Then you can use this on Windows 10 mail app. Or Do you want to use your Comcast account in Windows 10 mail app? If it is the 2nd option you will need to add your comcast account into Windows 10 mail app, see the process here:https://www.xfinity.com/support/articles/comcas...Note: This is a non-Microsoft website. The page appears to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the site before you decide to download and install it.

Hello. The Windows 10 email client is just software that gathers your email addresses in one place. You just add the email accounts. The iPhone also has a similar mail app. Just add your gmail and Comcast accounts per the link below:https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT201320

windows.symptom: Lost Office license after upgrading to SSD        I lost my Microsoft office license after upgrading my pc from HDD to SSD. The pc came with free Office.
solutions: Hi Abhinav Please explain what you mean by the PC came with free Microsoft Office . . . In generally PC's do not come with Microsoft Office and Windows does not come with Microsoft Office, it is a separate software product and is not free . ..Most PC's come with a free trial of Office 365 that will run out in approx. one month, some PC Manufacturers do provide a one year subscription to Office 365What version of Microsoft Office was installed on your PC and was that ever registered on Office.com to your account?Go to http://www.office.com and if you're not already signed in, select Sign inOn that page, do you see your Microsoft Office licence listed there?

windows.symptom: Win 10 Pro issue        When I attempt to shutdown the PC by choosing 'shutdown' from the start menu it will appear to shutdown but then start again. I've tried many of the so called fixes and none correct the issue. Got frustrated and wiped my drives clean (all 4 of them) and guess what?The issue still persists even after a complete clean install of the OS.This wasn't an issue ever until I attempted to shutdown yesterday to install a new SSD. I installed a new PCI-e USB 3.0 card roughly a week ago and the desktop shutdown perfectly just before installing the card in an x1 slot. The PCI-e USB card I purchased is the following:https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B072LS4JH7/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o01_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1Motherboard is a Gigabyte GA-Z68XP-UD3 rev 1.0 with the latest BIOS F-10(Rest of system)...Windows 10 Pro 1909 OS Build 18363.476 (clean install)Core i7 3770KG-Skill 32GB DDR3Asus RX 570 OCSound Blaster XFi Xtreme Gamer1TB Crucial MX500 SSD (OS drive)1TB Mushkin RAW SSD1TB Hitachi SATA 3 7200rpm1TB WD Black SATA3 7200rpmLG Blue Ray DLAntec 650w PSURosewill Mid tower Challenger
solutions: Hi 72. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.Have you tried removing the PCIe card to see if the problem goes away. If so examine the slot under a bright light to blow out any dust, reset card firmly and evenly. If the problem comes back RMA the card after discussing it with their included Support.If the card is absolved then try removing the SSD to test without it. If you don't have another hard drive you can create bootable Linux which is a great way to test hardware and absolve WIndows and the SSD/hard drive:https://www.pcsuggest.com/best-linux-live-distro/https://itsfoss.com/bootable-windows-usb-linux/See also known fixes for restart at shutdown in Windows 10: https://blog.techinline.com/2018/09/18/windows-...https://www.thewindowsclub.com/windows-10-resta...http://www.thewindowsclub.com/windows-will-not-...Update your drivers and BIOS/UEFI firmware from PC or motherboard maker's Support Downloads web page, using the full model number, Serial Number or Dell Service Tag on sticker. Compare the latest drivers available for download with the ones presently installed in Device Manager reached by right clicking the Start Menu. Make sure you have the latest BIOS or UEFI firmware, Chipset, Display (Video), Sound, USB3, Bluetooth, Network and all other drivers, or else download and install the latest now.Updating drivers from the Device Manager or Windows Update is rarely enough. The most basic thing we need to learn to maintain a PC is keep the latest manufacturer's drivers installed from their Support Downloads web page.Go over this checklist to make sure the install is set up correctly, optimized for best performance, and any needed repairs get done:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki... Start with Step 4 to turn off Startup freeloaders which can conflict and cause issues, then Step 7 to check for infection the most thorough way, then step 10 to check for damaged System Files, and also Step 16 to test a new Local Admin account. Then continue with the other steps to go over your install most thoroughly. If nothing else works then do a Repair Install, by installing Media Creation Tool, open tool and choose to Upgrade Now. This reinstalls Windows while keeping files, programs and most settings in place, and is also the most stable method to advance to the latest version. http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10/m... I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and keep me posted. If you will wait to choose if I solved your problem, I will keep working with you until it's resolved.________________________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.

I just finished wiping all the drives clean and re-partitioning them.No luck. Issue still persists. It existed before I attempted to shutdown and put in the new SSD. I ended up having to hold the power button down. However it was not an issue when I put the PCI-e USB 3.0 card in roughly a week ago. The desktop powered off without issue then. As for the BIOS (F10) it is the latest for my motherboard (GA-Z68XP-UD3 rev 1.0). I've tried all your other suggestions and no luck.The system is clean with no programs on it other than Windows 10 Pro 1909 OS Build 18363.476 (installed 12/6/2019)
Update:I removed the USB PCI-e 3.0 card and the issue vanished. I can now shutdown the system without issue.

I'm glad to hear that worked, Westy. You can try reseating the card to see if it comes back, or RMA it to the manufacturer.Let me know if there's anything else. Also when ready please mark the post which helped most as the Answer, to help others. A rating is also appreciated.

I emailed FebSmart and this was their response....Hello Jim Floyd,Sorry to hear that this usb card cased this restart issues.I just back from you mother baod data sheet,all the PCIE slot is a universal slot.Not yest defined by manufacture,and USB card hardware is working.But the restart issue alway make you unhappy then. I suggest you try to put it in other PCIE slot and check if it have same issue.At the same time , I suggest you reset PCIE slot to default setting.We can confirm that it is Windows10 system setting issue or BIOS setting issue. If you can try to restore windows it may helps also ,but this is the last option.  Kindly Try please. Louis.Z--------------------------Hello, Thanks for your message and updates.Actually you are the second users with this issue,after we test the same mother-board in our side in last case,all is normal in our side .So we think it is not a must problem,it have possibility.I am not sure if you want try to a USB card with a brige inside ,it may do not have this problems.The price is a little high Or I suggest you take a cheap USB card based on VL805 solution, seems like it can not works on your PC if using directly with RENSAS.Here is our suggestion:https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07NTZ84LD?ref=myi_title_dpIf you select our product,we can refund price gap for you.If you choose other sellers ,you may have to return this USB card ,or put it in other computers.https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07SRT4PLL/ref=twister_B081FZ1567?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1 Again,we sorry about we can not guide you solve your problems.Kindly Regards.Louis.Z-----------------------

And also this....And we got the feedback from other customer, same board on same system do not have the issues,but I remember it is a Gigabyte board as well ,not this model on you. System issue, We do not think users have to get latest system,cause USB 3.0 standard come out almost ten years ago. Can you put this card on PC, in windows device manager select this RENSAS card -let windows update driver ? This is the last option now. We may can not handle your problem. Sorry.

I'm glad to hear that worked, Westy. You can try reseating the card to see if it comes back, or RMA it to the manufacturer.Let me know if there's anything else. Also when ready please mark the post which helped most as the Answer, to help others. A rating is also appreciated.Funny thing is the card in device manager showed as working no problems. The only issue was not allowing Windows to shutdown.
Did you try another slot, to Update driver from Device manager, and their other solutions to be sure?If it still doesn't work I'd ask for a manager to get a refund.
No I did not the next available slot is too close to the side of the GPU with the fans. As for drivers the card does not require any off a disk just the Win 10 drivers.

I understand. I was referring to their request that you update the driver from the device manager. Did you try that? First try Automatic choice, then try Browse and Let me pick to try all previous drivers that were installed for that card.

windows.symptom: Shortcut key to change desktop background        There are a few threads about changing the desktop background. All of these claim there is no shortcut key. All the threads are locked, or I would add this query to an existing thread.Despite the claims to the contrary, I  have many times accidentally changed the desktop background when clicking on an image file (jpg, for example).  I don't know which keys I unintentionally hit. I would like to disable this feature, since accidentally changing the background is annoying.On a related note, I'd like to know where the background image is stored. That is, if I select an image to use for background, presumably Windows tucks away a copy of the file. Where is that copy?
solutions: Hi, I'm not sure if this is the hotkey you are referring to but you can press Shift + F10 to skip to the next desktop background.As for the folder the current desktop background is stored in, it's a bit more complicated. %AppData%\Microsoft\Windows\Themes\CachedFiles contains a cached copy of the current background. But the file in use is in the parent directory %AppData%\Microsoft\Windows\Themes, however this isn't a plain file it will just show as type "File" and needs decoding from binary to be opened.

However, do watch out for the ads.

windows.symptom: No log in screen and keyboard/mouse not working        I have windows10. Problems started with no internet. Now there is no log in option on the screen, just shows the time. Wireless Keyboard and mouse stopped working too. From googling possible fixes ive done the following:-Unplugged the wireless adapter, changed batteries on keyboard, turned off pc and unplugged for 10 minstried turning pc on and off 3 times to get auto repair option up but nothingthink i’m at the limits of my capabilities here unless someone can help.
solutions: Hi, MakkiMM My name is Jeffrey and I am an Independent Advisor. I would be happy to help you today.Try to enter the safe mode with the network function to repair, it may be that the network controller is outdated.Press and hold the power button for 5 to 10 seconds to perform a complete shutdownDo this three or more times. As soon as you see the Windows logo with the rotating dots, press and hold the power button until the computer turns off. Do this process twice..-Turn on your computer for the third time, and let it load. .-You should receive this message: Preparing Automatic Repair. After entering Mode Update the network driver may be outdated

windows.symptom: Windows 10 - RTX 2080 Ti - C49RG9x - NO SOUND via Displayport        HiI am currently running Windows 10 Education Build 18362.19h1_release.190318-1202. All drivers are properly installed and up-to-date.The problem is persisting for over 2 years now.Initially, I was running Windows 10 Pro with a GTX 1080 Ti on a Samsung CHG90 Display via Displayport, which means:Different Computer with ALL different Hardware, different Software, different Monitor, different Cable, but still the same problem!My Rear Panel 3.5mm Jack plays fine on any headphones. Also, my S/PDIF is working without any issues at all.Please DON'T suggest changing the Bitrate - there is only 1 option and the field is greyed out!I offer 1 Ethereum to the first person who can solve the mystery. (Microsoft Associates are not eligible for any reward.)And I encourage anyone else to curse Microsoft for their failures.
solutions: Have you ever heard back (no pun intended) from anyone?  I have the same problem.
Have you ever heard back (no pun intended) from anyone?  I have the same problem.Dear Kreigz. Apparently not. But 11 people do have the same issue.

How are you planning on hearing/routing the audio? The gaming monitors you are using have no built-in speakers, like a TV would. No Microsoft OS software update can fix that. Connecting the rear headphone jack to 3.5mm (analog) speakers or sound bar would be the method of obtaining audio out on those models. Headphone and mic out are the only audio-related outputs.

How are you planning on hearing/routing the audio? The gaming monitors you are using have no built-in speakers, like a TV would. No Microsoft OS software update can fix that. Connecting the rear headphone jack to 3.5mm (analog) speakers or sound bar would be the method of obtaining audio out on those models. Headphone and mic out are the only audio-related outputs. Dear TechfreakThat is indeed a very good question. First of all, HDMI and DP do both contain Auxiliary Channels. However, if you plug in headphones you either get horrible noise together with no windows sound on audio output or it gives no sound at all on mic. Nice try though. I didn't tell you guys the display had no speakers. ;D

windows.symptom: Windows hello 'couldn't turn camera on'        Having successfully updated win 10 and with windows hello working happily, this morning 16/9 it stopped working. I now get a message 'couldn't turn camera on.I have checked and all the drivers for intel realtek 3d camera are up to date. Can anyone help please?
solutions: Hello,Try to navigate as mentioned below and check if you're able to setup the Windows Hello.* Click Start* Select Settings and navigate to Accounts /> Sing-In options /> Windows Hello* Check whether you're able to make changes to the setting and setup Windows Hello there.If not, Use the System File Checker tool and DISM to repair missing or corrupted system files:Click Start.Type cmd, and then press CTRL+SHIFT+ENTER to open elevated command prompt(I.e. Command prompt with admin rights).If the User Account Control dialog box appears, confirm that the action it displays is what you want, and then clickContinue.Type or copy paste the below command lines into itwithout quotes:Reboot the system and check if problem resolved.“Sfc /scannow”"dism /online /cleanup-image /restorehealth"Let us know if problem still persist, we're glad to assist you. Hope this will address your query.

Thank you for your prompt reply and suggestion.I have run the routine as described in your response, the scan reported no integrity problems and the dism routine ran successfully but to no avail I am afraid following the restart.The only 2 events that could have impacted this situation that I am aware of are:a) A Windows security fix was downloaded yesterday morning before this problem ocurredb) Outlook would not start, so I contacted the MS HUP technical people and through a remote desktop connection they manually uninstalled Office and I reinstalled it with the result that Outlook is now working correctlyFurther advice gratefully received.

That's interesting.  I too had exactly the same problem with both windows hello and outlook. My techy guy resolved outlook by setting up a new profile.  WHat a pain the a*** to spend 2 days trying to open outlook.  Windows hello still not working but the camera opens fine with other programs.  There are loads of people with the same problem with a vast array of machines, many of them new and the most important thing THEY WORKED FINE BEFORE THE UPDATE.Please microsoft, stop telling people to check all their drivers, solve the problem.  It is well documented that new updates on Win10 often stop other things from working.  You never have this with apple. It is just not good enough.  My laptop is 2 weeks old and worked fine until yesterday. One of the reasons I bought it was for the windows hello facial recognition (sad I know but I thought it was cool) so for it to not work after 2 weeks is rubbish. WHAT IS THE FIX PLEASE?

After a morning spent with PC World and HP Tech Support I believe the issue to be as follows:1. Prior to AU (1607) my m/c was at 1511 (Windows build 10.0.10586)2. AU arrived on my box overnight on 11 Oct and the following day I saw- on my initial WIN 10 screen -  "Getting Started" followed 30 secs later with "Cannot start Camera. Please sign in with PIN"3. Drivers and BIOS Checked and updated where appropriate BUT . . . . 4. Realtek IR driver under "Device Manager" - "Imaging Devices" - "Properties" - "Driver" is at10.0.10586.11211, For a 1607 AU OS it should be most likely 10.0.14393.xxxxx - to reflect the 1607 product number!!So, until Realtek update their driver to the 1607 level, we shall just have to live with the camera being defunct - or roll back to 1511. As there are no Restore Points set with AU this means a Factory Reset  and loss of my environment (again!!) - NO THANK YOU!!Hope this helps, Regards, Chris

I had the same problem earlier. The problem showed up after I installed the software called Duet, which can set my iPad as second monitor. After I uninstall the software, everything was back to normal. You can check whether the problem is caused by some other software. Hope this could help you.

I also had the same problem after the latest Windows update on 7 August 2017. I did what ThosfikhAhamad suggested and it didn't work.Then I looked into Microsoft forum and found that maybe it's from the imaging driver.Click Start.Type Device Manager and select it.Look for Imaging Devices.Under Imaging Devices, you'll find your webcam device (mine isIntegrated Webcam)Right Click on the webcam device (Integrated Webcam), and clickUpdate Driver.If you're connected to the internet select "Search automatically for updated driver software". After that it will update and install the update for you.I hope this would work if other options didn't work.

Hi rolid,I have found something that might work.All you need to do is roll back the Windows Hello Driver, under System Drivers to a previous version.Had the same problem with my Surface Pro 4. It was working alright and then stoped working just like you described (one day it just stopped working), and now I have figured it out.Just roll back that driver to a previous version, and it should be back up and running.Should work for anyone with a Microsoft Surface product with this problem,other windows 10 computer, not so sure but try it, maybe it might work.Have asked Microsoft to fix this several times, but no reply but this is a short term fix that could get it working.Hope this helps.

windows.symptom: Taskbar on multiple monitors        My work computer was recently upgraded to windows 10.   On previous version I used a 3rd party software to extend the taskbar onto 2nd monitor.  I liked that ONLY those active tasks displayed on the 2nd monitor, since I do not want icons for tasks opened on primary monitor displaying on both monitors,  Is there some way to only have the active tasks display on the secondary monitor.   I do not need the start search and task view displayed in taskbar of each monitor nor do i need the tasks opened in  primary monitor displayed in taskbar of secondary monitor.   I generally have many apps running and it is helpful to only have the icons for open tasks displaying on secondary monitor.
solutions: Hi MJ1223 right click on the taskbar and select taskbar settings under "Multiple displays", "show taskbar buttons on", select "taskbar where window is open"this will not give you everything you want, windows icon, task view, and the clock are still shown,The search icon is not needed on any monitor, just click start and type the search, you can turn that off, right click on taskbar and select search-> hidden

windows.symptom: I want to change the color of the highlighting when selecting text, etc.  I have glaucoma and I cannot see the blue very well.        I want to change the color of the highlighting when selecting text, etc.  I have glaucoma and I cannot see the blue very well.
solutions: Hi, There's not currently a way to change this in the Windows settings. There are colour filters you can apply in the settings app under ease of access > Vision > Colour Filters.Alternatively you can do this with the registry editor. If open Regedit from the star menu and enter "Computer\HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Control Panel\Colors" into the address bar. There are "Highlight" and "Highlight Text" entries for the blue highlight background and the text colour when highlighted respectively. These are RGB colour values, you should be able to customise these here. Though they won't apply until after a restart, or sign in and out.I hope that helps.
